head.title: 10 Million Tons Of Trash in 16 Years

hedline.hl1: 10 Million Tons Of Trash in 16 Years

abstract.p: Westchester Resco, refuse-to-energy plant at Charles Point, NY, observing its 16-year partnership with Westchester County and Peekskill, NY, announces it has recycled 10 millions tons of trash (S)

block.p: Observing its 16th year as a partnership with the county and Peekskill, Westchester Resco, a refuse-to-energy plant at Charles Point, announced last week that it had recycled 10 million tons of trash and turned it into electric power.

Tom Maillet, manager of the plant, said 10 million tons is roughly equivalent to 10 million barrels of oil -- or 6.4 million megawatts of electric power, which in turn has provided 40,000 homes with electricity since the plant opened in 1984.

Observing its 16th year as a partnership with the county and Peekskill, Westchester Resco, a refuse-to-energy plant at Charles Point, announced last week that it had recycled 10 million tons of trash and turned it into electric power.

Tom Maillet, manager of the plant, said 10 million tons is roughly equivalent to 10 million barrels of oil -- or 6.4 million megawatts of electric power, which in turn has provided 40,000 homes with electricity since the plant opened in 1984.
Resco is an acronym for Refuse Energy Systems Company, a company that is privately owned by Wheelabrator Technologies of Hampton, N.H.
Last year, the plant completed a Clean Air Act retrofit, installing equipment to reduce air pollution.
